getAdSize().Description: Returns the size of the currently displayed banner ad. Returns null if @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView#setAdSizes_E@ hasn't been called yet. See @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView#getAdSizes_E@ for the ad sizes supported by this @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView_E@.

destroy().Description: Destroy the @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView_E@. This method should be called in the parent Activity's @B_android#app#Activity#onDestroy_E@ method. No other methods should be called on the @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView_E@ after @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView#destroy_E@ is called.

recordManualImpression().Description: Record a manual impression. @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdRequest#Builder#setManualImpressionsEnabled_E@ must be enabled for this method to have any effect.

pause().Description: Pause any extra processing associated with this @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView_E@. This method should be called in the parent Activity's @B_android#app#Activity#onPause_E@ method.

Throws: If the size of the banner ad or the ad unit ID have not been set.
loadAd(com.google.android.gms.ads.double.Description: Start loading the ad on a background thread.

getMediationAdapterClassName().Description: Returns the mediation adapter class name. In the case of a mediated ad response, this is the name of the class that was responsible for performing the ad request and rendering the ad. For non-mediated responses, this value will be null.

getAdSizes().Description: Returns the ad sizes supported by this @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView_E@. See @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView#getAdSize_E@ for the size of the currently displayed banner ad.

Throws: If adSizes is null or empty.
setAdSizes(com.google.android.gms.ads.Ad.Description: Sets the supported sizes of the banner ad. In most cases, only one ad size will be specified. Multiple ad sizes can be specified if your application can appropriately handle multiple ad sizes. For example, your application might call @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView#getAdSize_E@ during the @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#AdListener#onAdLoaded_E@ callback and change the layout according to the size of the ad that was loaded. If multiple ad sizes are specified, the @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView_E@ will assume the size of the first ad size until an ad is loaded. This method also immediately resizes the currently displayed ad, so calling this method after an ad has been loaded is not recommended unless you know for certain that the content of the ad will render correctly in the new ad size. This can be used if an ad needs to be resized after it has been loaded. If more than one ad size is specified, the currently displayed ad will be resized to the first ad size.

resume().Description: Resume a @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView_E@ after a previous call to @B_com#google#android#gms#ads#doubleclick#PublisherAdView#pause_E@. This method should be called in the parent Activity's @B_android#app#Activity#onResume_E@ method.

Throws: If the ad unit ID was already set.
